author: TNN
description: Viswashkumar Ramesh, a British national, miraculously survived the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, escaping with minor injuries while all other passengers perished. Recounting the horrific experience from his hospital bed, Viswash described feeling the plane struggle immediately after takeoff before it crashed.
title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Just can't believe my luck, says 'The Man Who Lived'

author: NAOMI CANTON
description: Following the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, attorneys for Boeing whistleblower Sam Salehpour are urging the FAA to release its findings on alleged structural defects in Boeing's 787 aircraft. Salehpour had previously raised concerns about the integrity of Boeing's 787 and 777 planes, prompting an FAA investigation.
title: AI crash: Publish Boeing report immediately, says whistleblower's lawyer to US FAA

author: TNN
description: The wreckage of the crashed Air India flight AI 171 in Ahmedabad yielded the aircraft's black box and additional bodies, tragically raising the death toll to 274. Authorities believe some victims were from the nearby BJ Medical College campus. The black box, crucial for determining the cause of the crash, was recovered from the college's mess rooftop.
title: Air India plane crash: Toll mounts to 274; 33 on-ground deaths confirmed

author: TNN
description: Air India flight 171's crash, resulting in over 250 deaths, marks a dark chapter for the Tata Group, according to Chairman N Chandrasekaran. He assured full support and transparency in the investigation involving teams from India, the UK, and the US. The group is providing assistance to affected families, with Tata Trusts considering financial aid.
title: Gujarat plane crash: 'One of the darkest days in Tata Group's history', says chairman

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Tensions soar as Iran launches a missile barrage on Israel, retaliating for strikes on its nuclear and military sites. Explosions rocked cities like Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, with many missiles intercepted. Israel's earlier assault, involving numerous aircraft, targeted key Iranian facilities and killed top commanders.
title: Watch: Iran launches massive missile attack on Israel; explosions rock cities

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Following the Air India flight AI 171 crash, the Modi government has formed a high-level committee, led by the Union home secretary, to investigate the incident's causes. The committee will review existing protocols, assess contributing factors like mechanical failure and human error, and recommend improvements.
title: Air India plane crash: Govt forms high-powered panel led by Union home secretary

author: RAJIB DUTTA
description: A major gas leak at ONGC's Rudrasagar oilfield in Sivasagar, Assam, triggered widespread panic and the evacuation of 70 families. The incident occurred during routine operations by SK Petrochemicals, causing a high-pressure release of natural gas. Emergency protocols were activated, with SDRF and NDRF teams working to control the emission.
title: Assam: 70 families shifted after blast, gas leak at ONGC rig

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Prime Minister Netanyahu announced Israel's ongoing military offensive against Iran, claiming the destruction of key military and nuclear assets. This operation, dubbed 'Operation Rising Lion,' follows Iran's missile attack on Israeli territory, which Israel views as crossing a red line. Netanyahu urged the Iranian people to rise against their regime, as fears of regional escalation intensify amid the conflict.
title: Israel-Iran war: Netanyahu warns Iran ‘more is on the way’ after Tel Aviv strikes

author: NASEER GANAI
description: A political clash has erupted in Jammu and Kashmir over the mandatory Urdu test for naib tehsildar recruitment. The BJP seeks to scrap the requirement, citing discrimination against Hindi and Punjabi speakers, while the PDP defends Urdu as a vital part of J&K's heritage and official language.
title: Jammu and Kashmir: Row erupts over BJP call to drop Urdu criteria from test

author: TNN
description: The Kerala High Court has criticized the Union government for its delayed response regarding loan waivers for victims of the July 2024 landslides in Wayanad. The Centre cited the omission of a section in the Disaster Management Act as a reason for its inaction.
title: Kerala high court slams Centre over indecision on Wayanad loan relief

author: RAM SUNDARAM
description: A Chennai court acquitted Nag Narayan Prasad in a narcotics case due to critical prosecution errors. The primary issue was the submission of a key witness statement in Hindi without translation, rendering it inadmissible. Further weakening the case, crucial witnesses were not examined, and digital evidence lacked proper certification, leading to the accused's release due to insufficient evidence.
title: Lost in translation: Hindi statement sinks drug case in Tamil Nadu court

author: ARSHAD AFZAL KHAN
description: Authorities in Ayodhya and Barabanki, Uttar Pradesh, have denied permission for two annual Urs ceremonies, citing potential law and order issues. The Ayodhya denial followed a VHP complaint alleging the event was being held in the name of "Ghazi Baba," referencing Mahmud of Ghazni's military commander. Barabanki's denial stemmed from concerns about communal tension and unrest.
title: Uttar Pradesh blocks two Urs events citing law & order concerns

author: TNN
description: Pinal Mistry, a 24-year-old from Anand, tragically became a victim of the Air India flight due to a last-minute change in her travel plans. She had been in India for dental treatment following a car accident and was returning to England to resume her online business. Her father, Suresh Mistry, is now awaiting DNA analysis to confirm the devastating news.
title: Ahmedabad plane crash: For this Anand girl, a change of flight was a change of fate

author: YOGESH CHAWDA
description: A mother's quick thinking and a nanny's bravery saved a two-year-old girl from a fire caused by the AI 171 crash at BJ Medical college hostel. The nanny moved the child to a higher floor to avoid smoke inhalation before rescuers asked them to jump to safety.
title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Quick-thinking nanny saves 2-year-old

author: PRASHANT RUPERA
description: Rajnikant Patel, his wife Divya, and his sister-in-law Hemangini tragically died in a plane crash en route to the UK to celebrate their daughter Dhvani's graduation. The family, owners of Krishna Riverside Resort, were known for their hospitality and close-knit relationships.
title: AI crash: It was to be a reunion in UK. Now, Vasad joint family mourns loss of 3 members

author: TUSHAR TERE
description: Kalpana Prajapati from Manjalpur, Gujarat, tragically perished on a flight from Ahmedabad after delaying her trip to London to wait for her sister-in-law's visa approval. When the sister-in-law's visa was rejected, Kalpana booked a flight for June 12, a decision that ultimately led to her untimely death.
title: Air India plane crash: For 44-yr-old, a rejig in travel plans proved fatal

author: NIKHIL SHARMA
description: Madan Singh's family in Faridabad is devastated after his daughter, Khushboo, perished in the Ahmedabad-London flight AI 171 crash shortly after takeoff. Khushboo, who recently married and was en route to join her husband in London, had just bid farewell to her father at the airport.
title: Air India plane crash: She got married 5 months ago, was set to join husband in London

author: ANI
description: The fire, which had been raging for several days, prompted immediate action from forest authorities and emergency services as it threatened nearby villages and infrastructure, including the crucial national highway route.
title: J&K: Massive forest fire breaks out in Reasi; firefighting efforts underway

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Scottie and Larsa Pippen went through their divorce in 2021, which was followed by one of the many controversial relationships with Marcus Jordan. Larsa Pippen has a history of dating players from the NBA. She has also been linked to many high-end profile icons, such as The Rapper and Future.
title: Larsa Pippen’s dating journey: From NBA stars to rappers post-divorce

author: ABHILASH BOTEKAR
description: The Shani Shingnapur shrine trust in Maharashtra dismissed 167 employees, citing non-performance and absenteeism. A significant portion, 68% of those laid off, were Muslims. This action followed threats from a Hindu group demanding the removal of non-Hindus from the shrine's workforce, though the trust denies any discriminatory intent, stating the dismissals were disciplinary.
title: Maharashtra: After 'no non-Hindus' call, Shani temple fires 114 Muslim staff

author: PRABIN KALITA
description: The Assam government has issued a shoot-at-sight order in Dhubri, a town bordering Bangladesh, following communal tensions. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma cited a "communal group" attempting to destabilize the region, including alleged poster campaigns advocating for Dhubri's integration with Bangladesh.
title: Shoot-at-sight order at Assam border amid communal unrest

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: NBA legend Magic Johnson recently revealed a past betrayal by a former Los Angeles Lakers coach during an appearance on ESPN's 'First Take.' While discussing the Lakers' playoff exit and potential future ownership changes, Johnson recalled the 1981-82 season when tensions with coach Paul Westhead led to his firing.
title: 'I’ve been in this situation': Magic Johnson talks betrayal amid Lakers ownership buzz

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Tensions escalate as Iran launches a missile barrage on Israel, retaliating for Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and the killing of military commanders. Explosions rocked Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, with many missiles intercepted. Iran's Revolutionary Guard claimed responsibility, targeting Israeli military positions. The US had cautioned against strikes that could derail nuclear negotiations.
title: ‘Bring it to ruin’: Iran launches ‘dozens’ of ballistic missiles at Israel

author: TNN
title: ‘Bird hit' grounds Air India Express plane in Bangkok; may fly to Surat on Saturday

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Aiden Markram's stunning century propelled South Africa to a dominant position in the World Test Championship final at Lord's after a shaky start. He defied critics with his remarkable innings, joining an elite group of players to score a duck and a century in the same Test at the iconic venue.
title: From duck to 100! Markram shakes off failure, slams clutch century vs AUS; internet reacts

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 241 passengers and crew, safety concerns have risen. A resurfaced tweet from Elon Musk criticizing Boeing's management has added fuel to the fire. The DGCA has ordered enhanced safety inspections for Air India's Dreamliner fleet.
title: When Elon Musk suggested Boeing's problem may be having too many ...

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India's intrasquad game in Beckenham saw Shubman Gill and KL Rahul scoring impressive half-centuries, showcasing their batting acumen ahead of the England Test series. Shardul Thakur's bowling stood out, as he exploited the conditions to claim crucial wickets. The team observed a minute's silence for the Air India plane crash victims, marking a sombre start to their preparations.
title: Who did what on Day 1 of India’s intra-squad match?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's foreign exchange reserves witnessed a substantial increase of $5.17 billion, reaching $696.65 billion for the week ending June 6, reversing the previous week's decline. This surge was fueled by gains in foreign currency assets and a significant rise in gold reserves. The robust reserve position is expected to bolster the RBI's efforts to stabilize the rupee amidst global volatility.
title: Forex buffer strengthens: India’s forex reserves rise $5.17 bn to $696.65 bn

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: ‘A second chance’: Trump urges Iran to seek peace after Israeli strikes decimate nuclear sites

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a strike on Iranian military and nuclear sites, anticipating retaliatory attacks. He stated the US was informed beforehand, leaving further action to President Trump. Netanyahu aims to cripple Iran's missile production, revealing the operation was delayed. Iran has condemned the strikes as a 'declaration of war,' while Trump warned of harsher attacks if nuclear negotiations fail.
title: 'Expect several waves of Iranian attacks': Netanyahu after Israeli strikes; US shifts warships

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Following the recent surge in global crude prices due to escalating tensions in the Middle East, Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has assured that India possesses sufficient energy reserves for the upcoming months. He highlighted India's diversified energy sourcing strategy, ensuring affordability and sustainability.
title: India has adequate energy supplies, says Union minister Puri

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Google is intensifying its return-to-office mandate, compelling remote employees within 50 miles of offices to adopt a three-day on-site work week or risk job termination. This policy expansion coincides with voluntary buyout programs for select US-based teams, excluding divisions like DeepMind and YouTube. Executives emphasize in-person collaboration as crucial for innovation and employee engagement.
title: Layoffs at Google? Company tells these employees to choose: three days to... or accept severance

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel escalated its conflict with Iran, reportedly tricking Iranian air force commanders into a meeting before launching a major attack. The strike targeted nuclear and military facilities, resulting in the deaths of several top Iranian military leaders and nuclear scientists. In retaliation, Iran launched 100 drones, most of which were intercepted, further heightening tensions as Iran advances its nuclear program.
title: Op Rising Lion: How Israel tricked Iran's military leaders before striking

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Tesla has increased the prices of its Model S and Model X vehicles in the United States by $5,000 across all configurations. This price adjustment follows an update to these premium electric models.
title: Tesla price hike: Model S and X prices up by $5,000 in US after upgrades

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Big setback for Australia. Steve Smith is out of the World Test Championship final. He injured his finger while fielding. The incident happened during South Africa's second innings. Smith was attempting a catch at first slip. He has been taken to the hospital for treatment. His participation in the West Indies tour is also uncertain.
title: WTC Final, AUS vs SA: Why has Steve Smith been taken to hospital?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: A crucial breakthrough in the Air India Flight AI-171 crash investigation occurred with the recovery of the flight data recorder (FDR) from a medical college rooftop. The London-bound flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, killing 241 of 242 onboard. Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu hailed the recovery as "an important step forward.
title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Black Box found from AI flight; What it can tell us about tragedy

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Following Israeli strikes on Iranian military sites, Air India rerouted or turned back at least 16 international flights, including those from London, Toronto, and New York, due to the closure of Iranian airspace. Passengers faced significant disruptions, with the airline offering refunds and rescheduling options. The airline is offering full refunds or complimentary rescheduling to affected passengers and is arranging accommodation where necessary.
title: Close shave: AI London-Delhi flight was in Iran airspace when Israel launched missile strike

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli jets launched air strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites. This happened after President Trump urged Prime Minister Netanyahu to wait. Netanyahu called the operation 'Rising Lion'. The strikes strained US-Israel relations. Iran promised retaliation. Gulf states are worried about the fallout. Trump convened the National Security Council. Oil prices increased due to fears of disruption.
title: Israel strikes Iran: Netanyahu takes on 'Man of Peace' Trump; MAGA's moment of truth

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Netanyahu calls PM Modi, briefs him on Israel's devastating strikes against Iran

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: An Air India flight crashed in Ahmedabad near the airport. The crash occurred shortly after takeoff. The plane was carrying 242 passengers and crew. A massive fire erupted after the crash. Temperatures reached 1,000 degrees Celsius. Rescue operations were difficult due to the intense heat. Many bodies were recovered from the crash site. The incident also impacted nearby residential areas.
title: Plane crash: When AI jet became fireball; how 1,000°C inferno made escape impossible

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma visited Wankhede Stadium. Fans gathered to see him despite the heavy rain. He watched the T20 Mumbai League final. The crowd cheered for their World Cup-winning captain. Mumbai South Central Maratha Royals won the match. Rohit will lead India in the upcoming ODI series against Bangladesh and Australia. He aims to win against both teams.
title: Watch: Rohit Sharma mobbed by crowd amid Mumbai rain; video goes viral

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: After a public feud fueled by harsh online exchanges, President Trump has softened his stance on Elon Musk and Tesla. Trump, during a White House event, expressed his appreciation for Tesla and referred to Musk as a "friend," despite past disagreements.
title: Donald Trump praise: Says he likes Tesla; Adds a word for Elon Musk, “He’s smart, but …

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In a stunning operation, Israeli forces launched a surprise assault on Iran, targeting key military and nuclear sites. The attack, aided by covert Mossad operations, involved smuggled weapons and internal sabotage, crippling Iranian defenses. Explosions rocked Tehran, Isfahan, and Qom, resulting in significant damage and the deaths of high-ranking Iranian officials.
title: How precise was Israel's strike on Iran? 10 images show how it hit the bull's eye

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Equity markets faced a significant downturn over two sessions due to escalating Middle East tensions and surging crude oil prices, leading to a substantial loss of investor wealth. The Nifty and Sensex both experienced declines, with investor sentiment dampened by geopolitical uncertainty and the impact on sectors like OMCs and financials.
title: Investors lose Rs 8.35 lakh crore in 2 days amid Middle East flare-up

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: 19-year-old Indian shooter Suruchi Singh clinched gold in the Women's 10m Air Pistol event at the ISSF World Cup in Munich, surpassing France's Camille Jedrzejewski. This victory marks Suruchi's fourth gold and a hat-trick of individual wins. India's medal tally reached three, placing them fourth. Elavenil Valarivan and Sift Kaur Samra secured bronze medals in separate events.
title: Shooting World Cup: Manu Bhaker flops; Suruchi Singh clinches gold

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: In a day of Bollywood buzz, Aamir Khan confessed to a blackout drunk episode on his 60th birthday post quitting alcohol. Tragedy struck as Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur, passed away from a heart attack, possibly triggered by a bee sting. Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor were seen visiting Karisma.
title: Sunjay Kapur's demise allegedly after swallowing bee; Saif, Kareena visit Karisma

author: TOI TRENDING DESK
description: A voluntary recall has been initiated for Dr. Pepper Zero Sugar cans across Florida, Georgia, and South Carolina after it was discovered that some cans were mislabeled and contained full-sugar soda. The FDA has classified this as a Class II health risk, as consumption could pose temporary health consequences, especially for individuals managing sugar intake.
title: Zero-sugar soda cans recalled in the US: FDA cites class II health risk

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a significant development, the black box of the crashed Air India Ahmedabad-London flight has been recovered from a rooftop near the crash site. The tragic incident, which occurred shortly after take-off, claimed the lives of 241 individuals, including Gujarat's former chief minister, Vijay Rupani. An investigation has been launched to determine the cause of the crash.
title: Ahmedabad horror: Black box found on hostel rooftop; key to uncovering why AI-171 crashed

author: SAURABH SINHA
title: DGCA orders AI to carry out full safety inspection of its 787-8/9 fleet

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: Adriyan Karmakar, once losing interest in shooting, found renewed passion through his father's guidance. He secured a silver medal in the 50m rifle prone event at the ISSF Junior World Cup in Suhl, Germany. He became the first Indian to achieve this feat. Overcoming equipment issues, he utilised his father's old rifle.
title: Exclusive: India's next shooting star? How Olympian dad's words lifted Adriyan to WC medal

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel has claimed responsibility for an airstrike that killed General Amir Ali Hajizadeh, commander of Iran's revolutionary guard aerospace force, accusing him of orchestrating attacks against Israel. The strike, part of a broader offensive targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, has been met with strong condemnation from Iran. Supreme Leader Khamenei has vowed severe retaliation, raising fears of escalating tensions.
title: Iran-Israel conflict: Tehran's head of missiles programme killed in Israeli strikes

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Larry Ellison of Oracle has overtaken Jeff Bezos to become the world's second-richest person, fueled by a $26 billion surge in his net worth following Oracle's strong earnings report. Ellison's total wealth now stands at $243 billion, surpassing Bezos' $227 billion and Mark Zuckerberg's $239 billion. Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual with $407.3 billion.
title: Jeff Bezos loses world’s second-richest title after 8-long years to Larry Ellison

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Pete Carroll, the NFL's oldest coach, emphasizes competition and depth over relying on a single player. He instills pressure in rookies by making them feel constantly observed, pushing them to perform at their best. Carroll praises veteran Raheem Mostert and rookie Ashton Jeanty, excited about their potential contributions to the team's running back rotation.
title: Pete Carroll fires warning in Raiders camp: 'Everybody's watching you'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel launched a military operation, "Rising Lion," targeting Iran's nuclear and military installations, including the Natanz facility, in response to concerns over Iran's nuclear program. The strikes resulted in the deaths of high-ranking Iranian military officials and nuclear scientists. Iran retaliated with drone launches, and Supreme Leader Khamenei warned of severe consequences, escalating tensions between the two nations.
title: 200 jets hit 100 targets: How Israel carried out covert strikes deep inside Iran

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: The World Test Championship final at Lord's was marked by a sombre tribute to the victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash, with players observing a minute's silence and wearing black armbands. The Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff, claiming 265 lives. On the field, Australia held a 218-run lead, but South Africa fought back, leaving the match delicately poised.
title: Ahmedabad plane tragedy: AUS, SA players pay tribute, honour victims in WTC Final

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: A devastating Air India AI 171 flight crash in Ahmedabad, involving a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, resulted in the loss of almost all 245 on board. According to data from Aviation Safety Network, flying has actually become safer over the last few decades.
title: Air India crash: Flying has become safer over decades; last 5 yrs safest since 2000

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Air India flight makes emergency landing in Thailand after bomb threat

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner tragically crashed near Ahmedabad, marking the model's first fatal incident and raising safety concerns. The crash revives memories of past battery issues that grounded the fleet in 2013. Despite a strong safety record and numerous warning systems, this event casts a shadow over the Dreamliner's reputation.
title: Air India plane crash: How do Dreamliner's safety systems work? Closer look at key warning systems

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Assam's chief minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, has issued shoot-at-sight orders in Dhubri after a communal group allegedly desecrated a Hindu temple with cow meat on Eid. Sarma visited Dhubri, vowing zero tolerance for those who desecrate sacred places and promising severe consequences for the perpetrators. He stated he would even guard the Hanuman temple himself if necessary.
title: Assam tension: CM issues shoot-at-sight order; 'groups intend to damage temples'

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: NASA has postponed the Axiom-4 mission to the ISS due to ongoing air leak investigations in the Russian segment, in collaboration with Roscosmos. Recent repairs showed initial success, but a new pressure anomaly requires further assessment. The delay impacts Axiom Space's mission, intended to transport four private astronauts via SpaceX, while prioritizing safety and structural integrity.
title: Axiom-4 mission: Nasa postpones launch to investigate leaks, says report

author: NEEL KAMAL
description: Punjab Police have uncovered a chilling case of moral policing in Bathinda, where social media influencer Kanchan Devi, known as Kamal Kaur Bhabhi, was murdered. Amritpal Singh Mehro, a Nihang, allegedly orchestrated the crime, objecting to her bold online content.
title: 'Bold Instagram posts': Punjab influencer's murder linked to moral policing?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with the family of Vijay Rupani, the former Gujarat Chief Minister, expressing his deep sorrow over Rupani's death in the Ahmedabad air crash. Modi reminisced about their long association and Rupani's dedication to the BJP's ideology.
title: 'Can't believe Vijaybhai is no more': PM Modi on Vijay Rupani's demise; ex-Gujarat CM died in Ahmedabad air crash

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Ashwagandha, a popular herb in supplements, is linked to liver problems, including serious and fatal cases. Reports indicate liver injury occurring weeks after usage, with symptoms like jaundice and dark urine. Experts suspect withanolides may disrupt the liver's detox system. While millions use it safely, moderation and awareness are crucial to mitigate potential risks.
title: Common herbal supplement used to beat stress linked to liver toxicity

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: India head coach Gautam Gambhir returned home on June 12 as his mother suffered a heart attack on June 11. Gambhir is with his mother at the moment who is undergoing treatment in a Delhi hospital but is likely to rejoin the side before the first Test against England which gets underway on June 20.
title: Gautam Gambhir rushes back home due to family emergency

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: MCX Gold August 2025 contract witnessed a significant surge, opening at ₹100,300 due to geopolitical tensions and dollar weakness. Analysts suggest a buy-on-dips strategy near ₹99,000, citing strong support levels and a favorable risk-reward ratio.
title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook after Israel strikes Iran - should you buy or sell?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold rate today: Gold prices in India surged past ₹1 lakh per 10 grams on MCX, fueled by safe-haven demand amid escalating Israel-Iran tensions and a weaker dollar. Silver also saw gains, while global gold prices exceeded $3,400 per troy ounce. Analysts suggest a 'buy on dips' strategy, anticipating further price increases in the coming months, contingent on geopolitical stability and market dynamics.
title: Gold rate today: Gold prices cross Rs 1 lakh mark; where are they headed?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: As India prepares for the upcoming five-Test series against England, memories of past batting heroics on English soil resurface. From Rahul Dravid's resilience to Ajinkya Rahane's match-winning century at Lord's, these performances highlight the skill and determination required to succeed in challenging conditions.
title: IND vs ENG: Top 5 best Test knocks by Indian batters in England

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Vikram Misri and Sun Weidong met in New Delhi to improve India-China relations. They focused on people-centric engagements and resuming direct flights. Progress since their last meeting in Beijing was reviewed. Misri appreciated China's help in restarting the Kailash Manasarovar Yatra. Discussions included sharing hydrological data on trans-border rivers. Both sides aimed to ease visa procedures and promote exchanges.
title: India and China to rebuild ties; agree to resume direct flights

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: IndiGo's stock plunged roughly 6% following reports of InterGlobe Enterprises' plan to sell a 4% stake, aiming for $1 billion. This sale occurs amidst Rakesh Gangwal's ongoing share reduction since 2022.
title: IndiGo share price today: InterGlobe Aviation stock tanks 6%

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following Israeli strikes that killed senior commanders, Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei swiftly appointed Mohammad Pakpour as the new commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, replacing Hossein Salami. Abdolrahim Mousavi succeeded Mohammad Bagheri as the chief of the armed forces general staff.
title: Israel strikes Iran: Khamenei names new top brass after leaders killed

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites have triggered widespread air traffic chaos across the Middle East. Airlines are rerouting flights, leading to cancellations and increased fuel costs. Dubai Airport reported significant delays due to airspace closures over Iran, Iraq, and Syria. Iran's Supreme Leader has vowed retaliation, raising fears of a broader regional conflict.
title: Israel strikes Iran: Video shows how airspace cleared after attack; watch

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Israel-Iran flare-up: India says 'deeply concerned'; urges restraint

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's upcoming Venice wedding is facing strong opposition from local residents and activists. Protests have erupted over concerns that the lavish event is exacerbating overtourism, restricting public access, and straining the environment. Activists argue that the wedding is turning Venice into a playground for the ultra-wealthy, leading to demonstrations and banners displayed across the city.
title: Jeff Bezos & Lauren Sanchez wedding: Protests hit Venice churches; Banners target with message NO SPACE ...

author: TOI Education
description: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) has declared the SSLC Exam 2 Result 2025 today. Held from May 26 to June 2, the supplementary exams offered a second chance to Class 10 students who failed or aimed to improve their scores. Results are available at karresults.nic.in; practical exams were conducted on June 3.
title: Karnataka SSLC 2 results out: Click karresult.in to check result

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Next attack will be ...': Trump's chilling warning to Tehran after Israel strikes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Novak Djokovic reflects on his career. He speaks about his place among tennis greats Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal. Djokovic admits feeling like an outsider. He acknowledges the impact of cultural factors on fan support. He respects his rivals. He highlights the influence of their rivalries on his development. He shares his thoughts after his French Open exit.
title: Novak Djokovic 'felt like unwanted child' compared to Federer, Nadal; admits to changing demeanour to win fans over

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A Rajasthan family's dream of a new life in London ended tragically when the Air India flight crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, claiming 265 lives. Dr. Komi Vyas, her husband, and their three children were eagerly anticipating their reunion in the UK after years of planning.
title: One last selfie: Udaipur doctor family's final moments before Air India crash

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: An Indian Air Force Apache helicopter landed in Nangalpur. This follows a recent emergency landing near Saharanpur due to a technical issue. In April last year, another Apache was damaged during a hard landing in Ladakh. The Apache is a advanced attack helicopter used by the IAF and Indian Army. It enhances India's combat capabilities, especially in border regions.
title: Pathankot: IAF chopper makes emergency landing in Nangalpur area; second incident in a week

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Foxconn dramatically increased iPhone shipments from India to the US. This shift comes as Apple navigates trade challenges. Chinese smartphone exports to the US have significantly decreased. Apple is investing heavily in Indian production. Despite tariff threats, Apple continues to expand its operations in India. Experts predict India-made iPhones will account for a larger share of global shipments.
title: US-China trade war: How India turned into America's new iPhone factory; & why tariff threat may not stop it

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel Defence Forces carried out aerial strikes. The strikes targeted Iranian ballistic missiles. These missiles were positioned to attack Tel Aviv. IDF released video evidence of the operation. A nationwide siren was activated at 3 a.m. This was due to intelligence about an Iranian retaliation. However, the anticipated response did not happen immediately.
title: Watch: Footage shows Israel intercepting Iranian drones; destroying ballistic missiles

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Bangladesh's foreign ministry addressed the vandalism of Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home. A criminal case was filed, and arrests were made. The government reaffirmed its respect for Tagore's legacy. India strongly condemned the act. West Bengal's Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the issue with Bangladesh. Authorities are taking legal actions.
title: 'We hold Tagore in highest esteem': Bangladesh arrests two over poet's house attack

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Who were killed in Israel's strike? Iran's top brass targeted - full list

author: Deutsche Welle
description: Once allies, Iran and Israel's relationship deteriorated after Iran's 1979 Islamic Revolution, with Ayatollah Khomeini severing ties and criticising Israel's occupation of Palestinian territories. Despite some Iranians questioning this hostility, the current leadership, including Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, maintains an antagonistic stance, even denying the Holocaust. Some supporters of the Islamic Republic criticise Iran's reluctance to directly confront Israel.
title: Why are Iran and Israel sworn enemies?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump stated he had prior knowledge of Israel's strikes on Iran, emphasizing Iran must not acquire nuclear weapons. Israel launched Operation Rising Lion, targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while the US clarified its non-involvement, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Despite the attack, Trump advocated for a diplomatic resolution to the Iran nuclear issue.
title: Operation Rising Lion: Did Trump know in advance of Israel's strikes on Iran? What he said

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump advocates for the "remigration" of undocumented immigrants, a term linked to far-right European movements, criticizing the Biden administration's immigration policies and California Governor Gavin Newsom. He pledged support for ICE officers and vowed to reverse what he calls an "invasion.
title: 'America was invaded': Trump pushes for 'remigration'; slams Biden, Newsom

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In a dramatic escalation, Israel launched a significant attack on Iran, targeting nuclear and military facilities, resulting in explosions in Tehran. The strikes reportedly killed a top Revolutionary Guard leader and nuclear scientists. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserted the operation aimed to prevent Iran from developing nuclear weapons.
title: Why did Israel strike Iran? What makes the timing crucial – explained

author: H M CHAITHANYA SWAMY
description: A tragic collision between an APSRTC bus and a truck near Hoskote, Bengaluru Rural, resulted in the death of four individuals, including two children, and injuries to at least 16 passengers. Preliminary investigations suggest the accident was caused by the bus driver's rash driving, suspected drowsiness, and overspeeding while attempting to overtake the truck.
title: Bengaluru accident: 4 dead, 16 injured in APSRTC bus-truck crash near Hoskote

author: MUKUT DAS AND MANOSH DAS
description: Sonam, along with her accomplices, confessed to murdering her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, in a fourth attempt orchestrated between Guwahati and Sohra. Motivated by a forced marriage, Sonam and her friends plotted the murder in Indore before the wedding.
title: Honeymoon horror: Sonam says she was forced into marriage

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel has launched a targeted military operation against Iran, striking nuclear and military sites, including Tehran's ballistic missile program, citing a threat to its survival. Air-raid sirens sounded in Israel as a precaution. The attack follows rising tensions over Iran's nuclear program and a recent IAEA censure, prompting international concern and a surge in oil prices.
title: Operation 'Rising Lion': What nuclear facility did Israel strike in Iran? Why this site was chosen

author: MANJU V
description: Following the AI-171 crash outside Ahmedabad airport, videos have surfaced sparking questions among aviation experts. Pilots are questioning why the landing gear wasn't retracted, and if a dual engine failure occurred due to fuel issues. The final investigation report, due next year, will provide detailed analysis.
title: What caused AI-171 crash? 5 big questions, 2 short videos, zero clear answers

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Viswashkumar Ramesh, sole survivor of the AI 171 Dreamliner crash near Ahmedabad, recalls a violent jolt and the pilot's distress call before the aircraft disintegrated. The UK-based businessman, miraculously rescued from seat 11A, now lies in hospital, haunted by the loss of his brother and the devastating tragedy.
title: AI 171 tragedy: How seat 11A proved to be lucky for Air India crash survivor

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Hossein Salami, the Commander-in-Chief of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), has reportedly been killed in a targeted military operation by Israel. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced the operation, named "Rising Lion," aimed at dismantling Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs, citing the existential threat to Israel. Netanyahu claimed Iran possesses enough enriched uranium for nine atomic bombs.
title: Operation Rising Lion: Who was Hossein Salami? Iran's IRGC chief killed in Israeli strikes

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former NFL star Antonio Brown faces serious legal trouble. A warrant has been issued for his arrest in Miami-Dade County, accusing him of attempted murder with a firearm. The charges stem from an altercation outside a celebrity boxing event in May. Surveillance footage allegedly shows Brown firing shots at a man, who sustained injuries.
title: Boxing event shooting: Ex-NFL star Brown faces attempted murder charge

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Tensions escalate as Israel launches attacks on Iran's nuclear and military sites, including the Natanz facility, prompting international concern. Prime Minister Netanyahu asserts the strikes will persist until the threat is eliminated. The US acknowledges Israel's unilateral action, prioritizing the protection of American forces. Explosions rocked Tehran, with both nations closing their airspace amid heightened alert and emergency declarations.
title: 'Explosions across Tehran': Visuals capture Israel's strike on Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following Israeli military action against Iran, Iraq has shut down its airspace and halted all air traffic. Prime Minister Netanyahu confirmed the strikes, dubbed "Rising Lion," targeting Iranian nuclear and military facilities, while Israel's defense minister called them preemptive due to concerns over Iran's uranium enrichment. The US has denied any involvement in the operation.
title: Iraq closes airspace: All flights halted after Israel strikes Iran

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following Israel's strikes on Iranian nuclear and military sites, the Indian Embassy in Iran has issued an advisory urging Indian nationals and persons of Indian origin to exercise caution. The embassy emphasised vigilance, avoidance of unnecessary travel, and adherence to safety protocols advised by local authorities amidst reported explosions in Tehran and Natanz.
title: Israel strikes Iran: India issues advisory for nationals

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Air India changed several international flights because of the emergency in Iran. Flights to and from the US, the UK, and Canada were affected. Some flights were rerouted, and others returned to where they started. The airline is helping passengers with accommodations and refunds. Passengers should check their flight status for updates.
title: Israel-Iran conflict escalates: Several Air India flights diverted - full list

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Finn Allen's explosive innings of 150 runs off 49 balls propelled the San Francisco Unicorns to a record-breaking total in the Major League Cricket season opener. Allen smashed 19 sixes, setting new benchmarks for the fastest 150 in T20 cricket and most sixes in a men's T20 innings.
title: MLC 2025: Unicorns post 269/5 in record fest at Oakland Coliseum; Finn Allen slams 151

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday on global cues. While Nifty50 crashed below 24,550, BSE Sensex tumbles over 1,100 points.
title: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 goes below 24,550; Sensex tanks over 1,100 points

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Indian stock market on June 13, 2025, highlighting Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy, and Prince Pipes and Fittings as top stock picks. Nifty is expected to find support around 24,600-24,700, potentially reaching 25,300-25,500, while Bank Nifty aims for 57,000-57,700, supported by positive market internals.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: South African seamer Lungi Ngidi expressed optimism after Day 2 of the World Test Championship Final against Australia, despite a first-innings batting collapse. Ngidi highlighted the coach's encouragement to play with conviction and aim to turn the game around. He found his rhythm with Bavuma's guidance and drew energy from the crowd.
title: WTC Final: 'Two Balls Can Wrap It Up'; Lungi Ngidi on SA's fightback vs Aus

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shreyas Iyer faced another setback as his SoBo Mumbai Falcons lost to Mumbai South Central Maratha Royals in the T20 Mumbai League final, mirroring his IPL final defeat with Punjab Kings. Despite Iyer's emotional encouragement and Rohit Sharma's presence, the loss marked a second consecutive final disappointment for the Indian batter, leaving him to reflect on missed opportunities.
title: After winning five straight finals, Shreyas Iyer loses back-to-back title clashes

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump spoke about World War II. He mentioned conversations with Emmanuel Macron and Vladimir Putin. Macron spoke of France's victory. Putin highlighted Soviet sacrifices. Trump expressed surprise at America's lack of commemoration. He noted the US role in the Allied victory. He also mentioned Germany and Japan's current status.
title: 'Everybody hates Russia but loves Germany and Japan': Trump calls it a 'strange world'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Finn Allen's explosive century off just 34 balls propelled San Francisco Unicorns to a dominant victory against Washington Freedom in the MLC 2025 opener. Allen's record-breaking innings surpassed Nicholas Pooran's previous mark, setting a blistering pace for the tournament. San Francisco capitalized on the fresh wicket after being put in to bat, leaving Washington's bowlers struggling to contain the onslaught.
title: Finn Allen smashes fastest century in league history vs Washington Freedom

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Kagiso Rabada etched his name in South African cricket history, surpassing Jacques Kallis to become the fifth-highest wicket-taker across all formats during the World Test Championship Final against Australia at Lord's. Rabada's impressive performance, including a five-wicket haul, propelled him past Kallis's 572 wickets.
title: WTC Final: Kagiso Rabada enters South Africa’s top five Test wicket-takers

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a 'targeted military operation' against Iran, dubbed "Rising Lion," aimed at dismantling Iran's nuclear and ballistic missile programs. The strikes, which targeted key facilities like Natanz and nuclear scientists, come amid escalating tensions over Iran's nuclear ambitions and stalled negotiations with the United States.
title: Israel strikes Iran: ‘Hit at heart of ballistic missile programme,’ says Netanyahu; watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amidst escalating tensions over Iran's nuclear program, Israel launched preemptive strikes targeting Iranian nuclear and military sites, resulting in casualties, including key military and nuclear personnel. Prime Minister Netanyahu declared the operation aimed at eliminating the Iranian threat, prompting airspace restrictions and warnings of potential retaliation.
title: Israel strikes Iran: Iran Revolutionary Guards chief killed - 10 things to know

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Indian industrialist Sunjay Kapur, ex-husband of Karisma Kapoor, tragically died at 53 in the UK from a heart attack while playing polo. A bee entering his mouth reportedly triggered the event. Hours before, he tweeted condolences for the Air India crash. Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, and Malaika Arora were seen visiting Karisma to offer support.
title: Sunjay Kapur passes away at 53: Kareena, and Malaika visit Karisma's house

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, a Pakistani citizen residing in Canada, has been extradited to the U.S. for allegedly plotting an ISIS-inspired mass shooting at a New York City Jewish community center. The attack, planned for the anniversary of the October 7th Hamas attacks, was foiled through encrypted messaging app monitoring.
title: ISIS plot: Pakistani extradited over NYC terror plan; Encrypted message warned of largest attack on US

author: TNN
description: A devastating Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad claimed the lives of resident doctors and others near BJ Medical College. The aircraft struck residential buildings and the doctors' mess, resulting in immediate fire and chaos.
title: 'Had it been 2pm, more would’ve died': Inside doctors' quarters when plane crashed

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Tarun Mansukhani's 'Housefull 5,' starring Akshay Kumar, Riteish Deshmukh, and Abhishek Bachchan, premiered on June 6, 2025, with two versions. Despite mixed reviews, the film opened strongly, earning Rs 127 crore in its first week. However, collections dipped from Day 4, with Day 7 estimated at Rs 6.75 crore, showing a weekday decline in occupancy.
title: ‘Housefull 5’ BO collection: Akshay Kumar’s film touches Rs 127 crore

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Israel strikes Iran amid nuclear tensions: Operation is called 'Rising Lion' - What we know so far

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israel launched a military operation against Iran late Thursday, with explosions reported in Tehran. Israel's defense minister confirmed the 'preemptive strikes,' citing Iran's continued uranium enrichment. The US denies involvement, emphasizing the action was Israel's decision and warning Iran against targeting US interests.
title: 'Targeted military op': Israel attacks Iran, targets nuclear facilities; US denies involvement

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US President Donald Trump hinted at a potential policy shift on immigration, suggesting some undocumented immigrants could stay to prevent labor shortages in agriculture and hospitality. An executive order is being considered to protect farm workers, many of whom lack legal status but have worked for years.
title: Trump’s immigration shift? What US President said on farm labors; watch video

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Democratic Senator Alex Padilla was forcibly removed and handcuffed during Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's Los Angeles press conference, sparking national outrage. Padilla interrupted Noem to question immigration raids, leading to a confrontation where he was pushed to the ground. Democrats condemned the incident as an abuse of power, while Republicans defended Noem, accusing Padilla of inappropriate behavior.
title: Watch: Senator forcibly removed, handcuffed at Noem’s news conference

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Trump calls Musk friend who 'got a little bit strange'

author: SAURABH SINHA
title: AI crash: Pilot who took plane's delivery hoped it would retire in 30 years

author: NAOMI CANTON
title: Air India plane crash: Brits among dead, UK sends team to assist with crash probe

author: ARDHRA NAIR
title: Gokhale Institute & SIS now lock horns over cash control

author: TNN
title: Gujarat plane crash: AAIB to investigate crash, says government

author: TNN
title: Gujarat plane crash: Kin grieve lives lost too soon in a ball of fire

author: TNN
title: India in touch with China on lifting curbs on rare earth items
